title: Sharing Replays with Others Easily?
body:
Does anyone know if there's a way to easily watch someone else's replays?
As in, I send my replay file to someone and they open it and watch it? I know that it's possible since Kshawaay specifically asks for the .rofl files rather than the mp4s. I just don't know how to do it.

What I've tried so far is recording it with plays.tv and sending it that way, but it's hard to do since I want to send entire games. I've also tried making a random replay and copying the filepath and name to the desired replay, but that doesn't work either.

If anyone knows how, it'd be appreciated

replies.body:
In windows 10 (and I assume 7 & 8 as well) the .rofl files are found under:
C:\Users\[your-user-directory]\Documents\League of Legends\Replays

> [{quoted}](name=Modi,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=4XEN9vdt,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-11-07T05:06:23.233+0000)
>
> In windows 10 (and I assume 7 & 8 as well) the .rofl files are found under:
> C:\Users\[your-user-directory]\Documents\League of Legends\Replays

I know where to find them, my question was how to view it. I clearly said that I sent my replay file to someone, meaning I know where to find it.
Ah, I misread, apologies. I assume you tried having that player put the rofl file into the correct directory, and having them use league to play it?

There is no official way to do this, but I did happen upon a boards post where other players have done the same thing. Just know it's know it's kind of lengthy and a pain to do with [Replays](https://boards.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-creations-en/dldfIPki-tool-to-watch-replays-from-other-players).
